main_definition: The National Collegiate Athletic Association (NCAA) is an organization responsible for overseeing collegiate sports in the United States, particularly at the college or university level.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A specific type of competitive athletic association
meanings_and_examples.example: The NCAA basketball tournament is also known as 'March Madness.'

meanings_and_examples.definition: Referring to the NCAA Division I sports
meanings_and_examples.example: John plays in NCAA Division I for his university's football team.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An informal term used by students, alumni and fans of colleges/universities involved with NCAA athletics
meanings_and_examples.example: As a die-hard fan, attending the games at my school is part of being an 'NCAA' supporter.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A shorthand way to refer to student-athletes who participate in NCAA sports
meanings_and_examples.example: 'She has been a longtime member of her university's women's basketball team; she is an 'NCAA.'
